thread.title: What we know so far about Peterborough fire as emergency services attend Padholme Road blaze
thread.title_full: What we know so far about Peterborough fire as emergency services attend Padholme Road blaze

author: newsdesk@cambridge-news.co.uk (Tom Burnett)
title: What we know so far about Peterborough fire as emergency services attend Padholme Road blaze
text:
Dozens of firefighters are at the scene of a 'large fire' in
Peterborough tonight (Thursday, December 28). Emergency services are attending the blaze on Padholme Road. Cambridgeshire Fire and Rescue Service has said it was called to a fire in the roof of an industrial building. More than 30 firefighters are currently at the scene.
Emergency services were first contacted about the incident at around 8.50pm. Cambridgeshire Police has urged people to avoid the area and those living nearby have been advised to keep doors and windows shut due to smoke rising from the fire.
Live updates:
Updates on the Padholme Road fire in Peterborough as they come in
A Cambridgeshire Police spokesperson said: "Police are assisting Cambs Fire & Rescue Service at a large fire off Padholme Road in Peterborough. Please avoid the area, and keeps doors and windows closed to protect from smoke."
A Cambridgeshire Fire and Rescue Service spokesperson said: "More than 30 firefighters are tackling a fire involving an industrial building on Padholme Road in Peterborough. Crews were called to the scene around 8.50pm reporting a large fire involving the roof. Please avoid the area where possible and keep windows closed if nearby."
